dialogue_turns.speaker: Sophia
dialogue_turns.text: Astana's heating season is over, which, you know, a lot of people think that means it's suddenly summer weather.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Astana's heating season is over, which, you know, a lot of people think that means it's suddenly summer weather.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The heating season in Astana has officially come to an end, the city's akimat (local government administration) confirmed on Monday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Mark
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, right, but it actually ended on April 21st because the average daily temperature hit at least 10 degrees for five days straight. That's the official rule they follow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, right, but it actually ended on April twenty first because the average daily temperature hit at least ten degrees for five days straight. That's the official rule they follow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starting April 21, the heating season in Astana has concluded, officials announced. Earlier in April, city authorities explained that the decision to end the heating season is made once the average daily outdoor temperature reaches at least 10ÂC for five consecutive days.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Sophia
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and uh, Kazhydromet reported that on April 22nd, it was partly cloudy with some rain and even gusts up to 14 meters per second.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and uh, Kazhydromet reported that on April twenty second, it was partly cloudy with some rain and even gusts up to fourteen meters per second.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Kazhydromet, the weather in Astana on April 22 was marked by partly cloudy skies, occasional rain, and thunderstorms. Daytime temperatures reached between 21 and 23ÂC, with winds of 5-10 m/s and gusts up to 14 m/s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Mark
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, so not exactly beach weather yet, even with those daytime highs around 21 to 23 Celsius.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, so not exactly beach weather yet, even with those daytime highs around twenty one to twenty three Celsius.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Daytime temperatures reached between 21 and 23ÂC, with winds of 5-10 m/s and gusts up to 14 m/s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Sophia
dialogue_turns.text: And they're expecting more rain and thunderstorms on Wednesday, like, similar temperatures but pretty windy still.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're expecting more rain and thunderstorms on Wednesday, like, similar temperatures but pretty windy still.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Wednesday, April 23, forecasters expect cloudy skies with more rain and thunderstorms. The temperature during the day is expected to stay between 21 and 23ÂC, while nighttime lows will be around 10-12ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Mark
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting though, Almaty also ended their heating season, but they did it in stages starting back on April 10th.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting though, Almaty also ended their heating season, but they did it in stages starting back on April tenth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The heating season has also ended in Almaty. The process began in stages on April 10, starting with administrative buildings, schools, cultural venues, and other institutions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Sophia
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, they began with administrative buildings and schools first, right? Before moving to residential areas and hospitals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, they began with administrative buildings and schools first, right? Before moving to residential areas and hospitals.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The process began in stages on April 10, starting with administrative buildings, schools, cultural venues, and other institutions. Residential buildings, dormitories, hotels, and social facilities " including kindergartens, hospitals, schools, vocational institutions, and medical-social facilities " followed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Mark
dialogue_turns.text: Mhm, which makes sense—you don't wanna cut heat everywhere at once if there's a chance of a late cold snap.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mhm, which makes sense-you don't wanna cut heat everywhere at once if there's a chance of a late cold snap.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Sophia
dialogue_turns.text: For sure, especially with nighttime temps still dipping down to around 10 to 12 degrees. That's kinda chilly without heating.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure, especially with nighttime temps still dipping down to around ten to twelve degrees. That's kinda chilly without heating.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The temperature during the day is expected to stay between 21 and 23ÂC, while nighttime lows will be around 10-12ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Mark
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely, and you know, it's a good reminder that spring here can be pretty unpredictable, even after the official season ends.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely, and you know, it's a good reminder that spring here can be pretty unpredictable, even after the official season ends.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Sophia
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. So if you're in Astana or Almaty, maybe keep a sweater handy for the evenings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. So if you're in Astana or Almaty, maybe keep a sweater handy for the evenings.
